info.title: Veritek FL Search API
info.description:
VeritekFL provides background-check search APIs to query parties, cases, and court records across Florida counties. Use this API to submit search criteria and receive normalized case, charge, event, and docket details with tracking metadata.

Security: OAuth2 client credentials with bearer JWT tokens. Confirm the token endpoint and scopes with the implementation team; the OAuth link in externalDocs is under review.

Authentication: include the access token as: Authorization: Bearer <token>.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Search endpoints for parties, cases, and related records

post.description: Search for parties and related records using identifying information and optional filters. The service performs best-effort matching and may return multiple candidate parties; clients should use UCN or PIN where available to disambiguate. UCN and PIN together make a unique party record on the case.

requestBody.description: Provide the name and date of birth of the person being searched, and optionally the last four digits of their SSN, to initiate a search.

400.description: Bad request – the request failed validation.

401.description: Unauthorized – the token is either invalid or missing.

429.description: Too Many Requests – the rate limit was exceeded.

lastName.description: Last name of the person being searched.

firstName.description: First name of the person being searched.

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the person being searched. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD.

ssnLast4.description: (optional) The last four digits of the SSN for the person being searched.

filedDateFrom.description: (optional) Use this field to set a lower limit of the search range based on the ‘case file date’ value. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD.

filedDateTo.description: (optional) Use this field to set an upper limit of the search range based on the ‘case file date’ value. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD.

caseType.description: (optional) Use this field to limit searches to specific case types. The options are ‘CF’ for Felony; ‘MM’ for Misdemeanor; and ‘CT’ for Criminal Traffic. If none are provided, the system will default to all options included in the search.

countyCodes.description: (optional) Use this field to limit searches to specific counties. The options are: [1 - 67]. If none are provided, the system will default to all options included in the search.

includeDockets.description: (optional) Use this field to affirm the inclusion of progress docket records in the response. The default is to exclude [false] these records.

includeCharges.description: (optional) Use this field to exclude charge records from the response. The default is to include [true] these records.

includeEvents.description: (optional) Use this field to affirm the inclusion of court event records in the response. The default is to exclude [false] these records.

requestId.description: This is a unique value generated by your system for end-to-end tracking. The value provided will be echoed in the response.

requestTimestamp.description: This timestamp value is generated by your system at the time of the request. The value will be used to support response time metrics. Use the ISO 8601 format (UTC).

SearchRequest.description: The search request includes the search criteria available to query the VeritekFL data.

parties.description: An array of ‘Party’ objects that met the search criteria provided.

apiVersion.description: The version of the API used for this response (e.g. v1).

requestId.description: The echoed ‘request id’ value provided in the request by the caller.

receiptId.description: A unique identifier generated by VeritekFL to support internal logging activities.

responseTimestamp.description: This timestamp value is generated by VeritekFL at the time the response is returned. The value will be used to support response time metrics and will be in the ISO 8601 format (UTC).

warnings.description: Any non-fatal warnings or notes will be included in this field.

SearchResponse.description: The search response contains an array of ‘Party’ objects and response metadata.

ResponseMeta.description: The response metadata supports message tracking and system metrics.

ErrorResponse.description: In the event of an error, this message format will be returned.

ucn.description: The uniform case number is the definitive unique identifier for a given case. This value has a standard format used by all Clerks’ offices.

clerkCaseNumber.description: The local identification number assigned by a Clerk of Court’s office. The format of this value is not standardized across all 67 Clerks’ offices.

countyName.description: The name of the county this case was filed in.

caseType.description: The case type as defined by the Clerk’s office responsible for this case’s data.

courtType.description: The standard category (Felony, Misdemeanor, Criminal Traffic) that this case falls under for court assignment purposes.

clerkFileDate.description: The date the case was filed in the Clerk’s office. This value is used for any date range searching specified in the request.

caseStatusCode.description: The current status of the case.

Case.description: The ‘case’ object includes details of a case associated with a party that matched the search criteria in the request.

Charge.description: The ‘charge’ object includes details for a specific charge on this case. The charge object is built based on a phase precedence: Court > Prosecutor > Initial. If a charge has Court-phase data, only Court-phase fields will be populated. If not, it will fall back to Prosecutor-phase data, and finally to Initial-phase data.

chargePhase.description: Indicates the highest phase of the charge, which determines which set of fields are populated.

chargeSequenceNumber.description: The unique ID for this charge record.

trafficDispositionCode.description: For traffic-related cases, this value indicates the disposition of the traffic citation.

citationNumber.description: For traffic-related cases, this is the value assigned to the citation by law enforcement.

citationIssuedDate.description: For traffic-related cases, this is the date the citation was issued by law enforcement.

docketIdentifier.description: The unique identifier for this docket record.

docketActionDate.description: This is the date the docket was entered into the Clerk’s system.

docketCode.description: This is the standard type of docket this object represents.

docketText.description: This is the freeform text entered by the Clerk’s office for this docket record.

Docket.description: The ‘docket’ object represents a progress docket entry for this case.

eventId.description: A unique value that is a combination of the UCN, court appearance date (yyyyMMdd), and standard event code values.

courtAppearanceDate.description: The date the court event is/was scheduled to occur.

courtAppearanceTime.description: The time of day the court event is/was scheduled to occur.

courtLocation.description: The address where the court event is/was scheduled to occur. Virtual events may not include a physical address.

courtDivision.description: The administrative section of the court assigned this case.

Event.description: The ‘event’ object represents a court event associated with this case.

ssnLast4.description: (nullable) The last four digits of the SSN for this party.

pin.description: The unique party identification number for this record on this case.

lastName.description: Last name of the person on this record.

firstName.description: First name of the person on this record.

middleName.description: Middle name of the person on this record.

suffix.description: The name suffix, if available, for the person on this record.

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the person on this record, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

sex.description: The sex documented for the person on this record.

race.description: The race documented for the person on this record.

driverLicenseNumber.description: The government issued driver’s license number documented for the person on this record.

aliases.description: Alias records associated to this party record.

sentenceSequenceNumber.description: The unique ID for this sentence record.

sentenceStatusCode.description: The status of this sentence entry.

sentenceImposedDate.description: The date the sentence was issued by the Court.

sentenceEffectiveDate.description: The date the sentence effectively began based on the Court’s sentencing order.

sentenceCode.description: The type of sentence imposed. For example, probation, confinement, etc.

lengthOfSentenceConfinement.description: The amount of time a sentence or confinement action is assigned by the Court at the time of sentencing.

Sentence.description: An array of ‘sentence’ objects for this charge record.

bearer-jwt.description: Provide a valid access token issued by the VeritekFL auth server. Include as: Authorization: Bearer <token>.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: OAuth2 client credentials flow. Exchange client_id/client_secret at the token endpoint to obtain a JWT access token.
